com.azure.messaging.eventhubs

Interface PartitionProcessor


  • public interface PartitionProcessor
    The interface defining all the operations that must be supported by a single partition processor.

    An instance of partition processor will process events only from a single partition. New instances of partition processors will be created through PartitionProcessorFactory.

    Implementations of this interface also have the responsibility of updating checkpoints when appropriate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> close(CloseReason closeReason)
      This method is called before the partition processor is closed.
      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> initialize()
      This method is called when this EventProcessor takes ownership of a new partition and before any events from this partition are received.
      void processError(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      This method is called when an error occurs while receiving events from Event Hub.
      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> processEvent(EventData eventData)
      This method is called when a new event is received for this partition.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> initialize()
        This method is called when this EventProcessor takes ownership of a new partition and before any events from this partition are received.
        Returns:
        a representation of the deferred computation of this call.

      • processEvent

        reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> processEvent(EventData eventData)
        This method is called when a new event is received for this partition. Processing of this event can happen asynchronously.

        This is also a good place to update checkpoints as appropriate.

        Parameters:
        eventData - EventData received from this partition.
        Returns:
        a representation of the deferred computation of this call.

      • processError

        void processError(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        This method is called when an error occurs while receiving events from Event Hub. An error also marks the end of event data stream.
        Parameters:
        throwable - The Throwable that caused this method to be called.

      • close

        reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> close(CloseReason closeReason)
        This method is called before the partition processor is closed. A partition processor could be closed for various reasons and the reasons and implementations of this interface can take appropriate actions to cleanup before the partition processor is shutdown.
        Parameters:
        closeReason - The reason for closing this partition processor.
        Returns:
        a representation of the deferred computation of this call.
